00100 class ChainableException: public std::runtime_error
00101 {
00102 public:
00106         ChainableException():
00107                 std::runtime_error(""),
00108                 cause_()
00109         {
00110         }
00115         ChainableException(oryx_path_planning::ChainableException& exception):
00116                 std::runtime_error(exception),
00117                 cause_(exception.cause_)
00118         {
00119         }
00120 
00125         ChainableException(std::string& message):
00126                 std::runtime_error(message),
00127                 cause_()
00128         {
00129         }
00135         ChainableException(std::string& message, std::exception& cause):
00136                 std::runtime_error(genMessage(message, cause)),
00137                 cause_(cause)
00138         {
00139         }
00140 
00141         ~ChainableException() throw(){};
00142 
00147         std::exception& getCause(){
00148                 return this->cause_;
00149         }
00150 protected:
00151         std::exception  cause_;         
00152 
00153         std::string& genMessage(std::string& message, std::exception& cause){
00154                 message += "\nCaused By-> ";
00155                 message += std::string(cause.what());
00156                 return message;
00157         }
00158 };

00168 inline double roundToFrac(double raw, double frac)
00169 {
00170         return std::floor(raw/frac)*frac;
00171 }
00172 
00179 inline int roundToGrid(double raw, double resolution)
00180 {
00181         return (int)std::floor(raw/resolution);
00182 }
00183 
00190 inline double gridToReal(int grid, double resolution)
00191 {
00192         return (double)grid*resolution;
00193 }

00208 inline void castLine(Point& startPoint, Point& endPoint, int rgba, PointCloud& cloud)
00209 {
00210         int x_0 = startPoint.x, x_f= endPoint.x, x, delta_x, step_x;
00211         int y_0 = startPoint.y, y_f= endPoint.y, y, delta_y, step_y;
00212         int z_0 = startPoint.z, z_f= endPoint.z, z, delta_z, step_z;
00213         bool s_xy, s_xz;
00214         int error_xy, error_xz;
00215         int cx, cy, cz;
00216         int initial_size = cloud.size();
00217 
00218 
00219         //Figure out if the line is 'steep' along the xy plane
00220         s_xy = std::abs(y_f-y_0)>std::abs(x_f-x_0);
00221         if(s_xy){
00222                 std::swap<int>(x_0, y_0);
00223                 std::swap<int>(x_f, y_f);
00224         }
00225         //Figure out if the line is 'steep' along the xz plane
00226         s_xz = std::abs(z_f-z_0)>std::abs(x_f-x_0);
00227         if(s_xz){
00228                 std::swap<int>(x_0, z_0);
00229                 std::swap<int>(x_f, z_f);
00230         }
00231 
00232         //Calculate the delta in each axis
00233         delta_x = std::abs(x_f-x_0);
00234         delta_y = std::abs(y_f-y_0);
00235         delta_z = std::abs(z_f-z_0);
00236 
00237         //Calculate starting error values
00238         error_xy = delta_x/2;
00239         error_xz = delta_x/2;
00240 
00241         //Determine line direction
00242         (x_0>x_f)?(step_x=-1):(step_x=1);
00243         (y_0>y_f)?(step_y=-1):(step_y=1);
00244         (z_0>z_f)?(step_z=-1):(step_z=1);
00245 
00246         //Set up initial point
00247         y = y_0;
00248         z = z_0;
00249 
00250         //ROS_INFO("Calculated Line Parameters: s_xy=%s, s_xz=%s, delta_x=%d, delta_y=%d, delta_z=%d, step_x=%d, step_y=%d, step_z=%d",
00251         //(s_xy)?"true":"false",(s_xz)?"true":"false", delta_x, delta_y, delta_z, step_x, step_y, step_z);
00252 
00253         //Iterate across the line
00254         for(x = x_0; x<x_f; x+=step_x){
00255                 //store x,y,z for un-swapping
00256                 cx = x; cy = y; cz = z;
00257 
00258                 //unswap if needed
00259                 if(s_xz) std::swap<int>(cx, cz);
00260                 if(s_xy) std::swap<int>(cx, cy);
00261 
00262                 //Write out the point
00263                 Point point;
00264                 point.x = cx;
00265                 point.y = cy;
00266                 point.z = cz;
00267                 point.rgba = rgba;
00268                 //PRINT_POINT("Line Calculated", point);
00269                 cloud.push_back(point);
00270 
00271                 //update the y and z axies
00272                 error_xy -= delta_y;
00273                 error_xz -= delta_z;
00274 
00275                 //step y
00276                 if(error_xy < 0){
00277                         y+= step_y;
00278                         error_xy += delta_x;
00279                 }
00280 
00281                 //step z
00282                 if(error_xz < 0){
00283                         z+= step_z;
00284                         error_xz += delta_x;
00285                 }
00286         }
00287 
00288         //ROS_INFO("Line Generated, editing first/last point");
00289         //Set the RGBA values of the first and last point to their correct values
00290         cloud.at(cloud.size()-(cloud.size()-initial_size)).rgba = startPoint.rgba;
00291         cloud.at(cloud.size()-1).rgba = endPoint.rgba;
00292 }

00305 inline void castArc(int radius, double sweep_angle, int rgba, Point& origin, PointCloud& cloud, int quadrant=1, int plane=0)
00306 {
00307         int x = 0, y = radius;
00308         int g = 3 - 2*radius;
00309         int diagonalInc = 10 - 4*radius;
00310         int rightInc = 6;
00311         //Calculate the halfway cuttoff (we can use symmetry after this point to speed up calculations)
00312         double halfCutoff = std::atan2(1,1);
00313         //Calculate the cutoff point. If it's greater than pi/4, this won't actually matter
00314         double fullCutoff = oryx_path_planning::constants::PI()/2.0 - sweep_angle;
00315         //Calculate initial swept angle
00316         double sweptAngle = std::atan2(y-origin.y, x-origin.x);
00317         //Draw the first half of the arc, or the whole arc if the sweep angle is less than pi/4
00318         while (sweptAngle>fullCutoff&&sweptAngle>halfCutoff) {
00319                 //Build the point.
00320                 Point point;
00321                 point.x = x;
00322                 point.y = y;
00323                 point.z = 0;
00324                 point.rgba = rgba;
00325                 //Calculate the currently swept angle
00326                 sweptAngle = std::atan2(point.y, point.x);
00327                 //Adjust the sign of the x/y values to account for quadrant changes
00328                 switch(quadrant){
00329                 case 2:
00330                         point.x = -point.x;
00331                         break;
00332                 case 3:
00333                         point.x = -point.x;
00334                         point.y = -point.y;
00335                         break;
00336                 case 4:
00337                         point.y = -point.y;
00338                         break;
00339                 }
00340                 /*Point pointBottom;
00341             pointBottom.x = point.y;
00342             pointBottom.y = point.x;
00343             pointBottom.z = point.z;
00344             pointBottom.rgba = rgba;*/
00345                 switch(plane){
00346                 case 1:
00347                         std::swap<float>(point.x, point.z);
00348                         //std::swap<float>(pointBottom.x, pointBottom.z);
00349                         break;
00350                 case 2:
00351                         std::swap<float>(point.y, point.z);
00352                         //std::swap<float>(pointBottom.y, pointBottom.z);
00353                         break;
00354                 }
00355                 if (g >=  0) {
00356                         g += diagonalInc;
00357                         diagonalInc += 8;
00358                         y -= 1;
00359                 }
00360                 else {
00361                         g += rightInc;
00362                         diagonalInc += 4;
00363                 }
00364                 rightInc += 4;
00365                 x += 1;
00366                 //cloud.push_back(pointTop);
00367                 //PRINT_POINT("Arc Generated Bottom Point", point);
00368                 cloud.push_back(point);
00369         }
00370         //ROS_INFO("Reached Swept Angle %f, Goal Angle%f", sweptAngle, sweep_angle);
00371         //If the full arc was greater than pi/4, build the rest of the arc from symmetry
00372         if(sweep_angle>halfCutoff){
00373                 for(int index=cloud.size()-1; index>=0; index--){
00374                         Point& point = cloud.at(index);
00375                         //otherwise push back the symmetric point
00376                         Point pointSym;
00377                         switch(plane){
00378                         case 1:
00379                                 pointSym.x = point.x;
00380                                 pointSym.y = point.z;
00381                                 pointSym.z = point.y;
00382                                 break;
00383                         case 2:
00384                                 pointSym.x = point.z;
00385                                 pointSym.y = point.y;
00386                                 pointSym.z = point.x;
00387                                 break;
00388                         case 0:
00389                         default:
00390                                 pointSym.x = point.y;
00391                                 pointSym.y = point.x;
00392                                 pointSym.z = point.z;
00393                                 break;
00394                         }
00395                         pointSym.rgba = point.rgba;
00396                         //PRINT_POINT("Arc Generated Top Point", pointSym);
00397                         cloud.push_back(pointSym);
00398                         //ROS_INFO("Reached Swept Angle %f, Goal Angle%f", std::atan2(point.y, point.x), sweep_angle);
00399                         //If the next point is past the sweep angle, than we're done. break
00400                         sweptAngle = std::atan2(pointSym.y, pointSym.x);
00401                         if(sweptAngle>sweep_angle){
00402                                 //ROS_INFO("I'm breaking cuz I got to the angle I wanted");
00403                                 break;
00404                         }
00405                 }
00406         }
00407         //If we're sweeping more than PI/2, need to use additional symmetry to finish the arc
00408         if(sweep_angle>oryx_path_planning::constants::PI()/2){
00409                 ROS_INFO("I'm doing the arc past pi/2");
00410                 double remainingSweep = sweep_angle-oryx_path_planning::constants::PI()/2;
00411                 for(int index = cloud.size()-1; index>=0; index--){
00412                         Point pointFinal;
00413                         Point& point = cloud.at(index);
00414                         switch(quadrant){
00415                         case 2:
00416                                 break;
00417                         case 3:
00418                                 break;
00419                         case 4:
00420                                 break;
00421                         case 0:
00422                         default:
00423                                 pointFinal.x = point.x;
00424                                 pointFinal.y = -point.y;
00425                                 pointFinal.z = point.z;
00426                                 pointFinal.rgba = point.rgba;
00427                                 break;
00428                         }
00429                         cloud.push_back(pointFinal);
00430                         Point checkPoint;
00431                         checkPoint.getVector4fMap()=pointFinal.getVector4fMap()-origin.getVector4fMap();
00432                         if(std::abs(std::atan(checkPoint.y/checkPoint.x))>remainingSweep) break;
00433                 }
00434         }
00435 }
